body: ${2:This macro returns the quotient and the remainder of a/b.}
'a' 'parameter a just below on the stack'
'q' 'the quotient of a/b, N-1 on the stack'
'r' 'the remainder of a/b, on the TOP of the stack'}
${6:  'start' NOW 1 h -  // timestamp or ISO8601 string}
${7:  'count' 1000 // optional: limit to 1000 points per gts}
${8:  'boundary' 1 // optional: also fetch one point before and after required timerange}
${9:  'timestep'  5 s // optional: one point every 5 second. see also 'sample' for faster random selection.}
${10:  'step'  10 // optional: returns one point out of 10}
${11:  // see documentation for pagination, gts pagination, and more fetch options}
'pre' {3:pre} // tick number when positive, time span when negative
'post' {3:post} // tick number when positive, time span when negative

// 'occurrences' {4:occurrences} // When it is a LONG value, limit the number of computations to that number (negative sign to go backward). When it is a LIST of LONG, compute a value for each tick of the list.
// 'step' {4:step} // The step size in number of ticks. defaults to 1.
// 'override' overrideTickBOOLEAN // If set to true, the tick value returned by the mapper is used to update the current tick. Defaults to false.
//try to read data from SHared Memory
//when not found, store data in SHM
//finally, load the reference from SHM and store it
%> 'myMutex' MUTEX //prevent a concurrent execution on the same SHM data
shm.description: Keep fetched data in RAM. You need to enable the SHM extension.

body: // '.cap:maxops'  10e9 TOLONG TOSTRING // capability to raise maxops to 10 billions of operations
// '.cap:tokengen'  ''                 // capability to use TOKENGEN within WarpScript
NEWGTS 1 100 <% NaN NaN NaN RAND ADDVALUE %> FOR

discovery (ex1).description: Discovery within WarpScript with autorefresh with macros executed by the dashboard
body: // (endpoint of your Warp 10 exec endpoint is mandatory if you also use Discovery Explorer)
// (theme can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / chalk / vintage)
'ts' STORE \$g \$ts RAND + STU * NOW + NaN NaN NaN RAND ADDVALUE DROP
// the `// @preview discovery` will wrap the execution result in a html page, using <discovery-dashboard> webcomponent.
// (endpoint of your Warp 10 exec endpoint is mandatory if you also use Discovery Explorer)
// (can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / vintage)
true 'debug' STORE // add a debug panel to understand events
'type' 'flex' // no need to specify each tile x y position
'vars' { // list of dashboard variables (can be set via dashboard url too)
// when refering to a variable defined outside the tile macro and not in dashboard vars,
// use early binding:  !\$xxx  will replace the variable by its content during the first execution.
// a popup triggered by a button can be usefull to hide some less usefull features of your dashboard.
// note that buttons can do other things. try 'discovery-tile 11 input:button' snippet.
// This event will send an event to the dashbard itself. At the dashboard level, you must subscribe the event by adding:
// the value of a popup event is a tile (you can also insert it with any 'discovery-tile xxx' snippet
} // end of the tile in the popup event
{ // this display will help you to debug your event source
'macro' <%  // you can write html in a display tile data...
'globalParams'  { 'fadeOutAfter' 2 } // fade out 2 seconds after the macro execution
\$startDate \$endDate <% 1 h + %> <% NaN NaN NaN RAND ADDVALUE %> FORSTEP 'gts' STORE
// when refering to a variable defined outside the tile macro and not in dashboard vars,
// use early binding:  !\$xxx  will replace the variable by its content during the first execution.
// the `// @preview discovery` will wrap the execution result in a html page, using <discovery-dashboard> webcomponent.
// this file, saved as xxx.mc2, can be served directly by discovery-explorer.
// (endpoint of your Warp 10 exec endpoint is mandatory if you also use Discovery Explorer)
// (can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / chalk, as in Discovery Explorer)
'type' 'scada' // need to specify each tile w h size and x y position
'vars' { // list of dashboard variables (can be set via dashboard url too)
// the first tile is an SVG image: the macro returns a multiline string for the svg content
'options' { // this svg tile is now listening to xpath or style events
'eventHandler' 'type=(xpath|style),tag=mycontrol' // listen for value0 to value9 xpath or style events
// this tile is an hidden controller that subscribes to input events and send xpath events
// the value for the second axis rotation cannot be grater than twice the first one:
// the events are style events. It can also be xpath events with a Xpath selector.
'#arm'    'transform-box: view-box; transform-origin: 116px 301px; transform: rotate(' \$slider1value -1 * TOSTRING + 'deg) ; transition: all .3s ease-in;' +
'#subarm' 'transform-box: fill-box; transform-origin: 11px 10px;   transform: rotate(' \$subarmAngle  TOSTRING + 'deg) ;transition: all .3s ease-in;' +
// this slider controls the axis 1 angle
'options' { 'input' { 'showButton' false } } // when false, event is sent when click is released
// this slider controls the axis 2 angle
'options' { 'input' { 'showButton' false } } // when false, event is sent when click is released
// the `// @preview discovery` will wrap the execution result in a html page, using <discovery-dashboard> webcomponent.

discovery ex4.description: Discovery dashboard that build a discovery dashboard
body: // (endpoint of your Warp 10 exec endpoint is mandatory if you also use Discovery Explorer)
// (can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / vintage)
// fetch in the database system list, sensor list.
{  // the button listen to both inputs (tag input)
'title' 'Once parameters are defined, build dashboard below'
// when loaded, a button returns a macro to execute on each click
// In this example, the button update two variables for components who listen to applybutton tag
'globalParams' { 'button' { 'label' 'Build Dashboard ' \$systemCheckBoxList SIZE TOSTRING + ' x ' + \$sensorCheckBoxList SIZE TOSTRING + } }
//  As this one does a heavy job, we do not want it to be refresh on each input change.
//  So, it listens to 'applybutton' tag only.
'cols' 100 // the dashboard in the dashboard can have different properties
// the first time this dashboard is loaded, the ChildSensorCheckBoxList variable
// is not defined anywhere. SYMBOLS returns a list of defined variable.
// you can fetch data for all sensor and system in a single fetch here.
'data' '' // any number or string, or html string
'data' { // no macro, return the data structure directly to avoid requests to the server

discovery ex5.prefix: discovery example 5: svg, xpath and svg events
body: // endpoint can also be https://yourcompany.senx.io/api/saas/warp/ with the following settings:
// (can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / vintage)
'type' 'flex' // flex : no need to specify each tile x y position
'vars' { // list of dashboard variables (can be set via dashboard url too)
// list of tiles (type discovery-tiles to get some snippets)
'type' 'svg' 'w' 2 'h' 3 // this svg tile was created with inkscape
// this may not be the ideal tool, but it allows you to customize object id with its xml editor (crtl+maj+x)
B64-> UNGZIP 'utf-8' BYTES-> // gzip and b64 encoding to save space. the output is an svg string. The most efficient way is to move the image in a macro on your server.
'eventHandler' 'type=xpath,tag=input' // the svg tile will listen to xpath events
'handlers' [  // here, we will create an event emitter (clickable area)
'selector' '#groupbutton'  // this is a css selector, not a xpath
'value' { 'buttonClicked' 0 }  // no matter the variable value, the event will trigger the display tile
'options' { 'eventHandler' 'type=variable,tag=buttonClick' } // subscribe to events: buttonClick (from the svg)
'fadeOutAfter' 1 // the tile content fade out 1 second after the event
'localvars' { 'onOff' \$onOff } // save onOff for next iteration of this tile (new feature)
'tags' 'input' 'type' 'xpath'  // this tile will send a xpath event to change a property inside the svg
'selector' '//*[@id="rect829"]' // this is a xpath. to select an id, use //*[@id="XX"] to have the same selection as #XX in CSS.
'value' { 'style' \$onOff <% \$greenStyle %> <% \$redStyle %> IFTE  } // replace the style attribute of this element in the svg
'data' <%  // when loaded, a button returns a macro to execute on each click
// this image is a few kilobytes. press Alt+Z to toggle you editor automatic line break...
'value' { 'xlink:href' \$imageData  } // here, the event will update the xlink:href attribute of the image placeholder in the svg
// same as previous tile, update an image placeholder
// another way to inject data in a svg is to use a hidden tile as a controller.
// If showButton is false, the event is sent at each letter you type in the input field
//  This can lead to lots of events per second. To throttle this, you can use { 'showButton' false 'delayRequest' 1000 }:
//  It will delay the event to delayRequest milliseconds after last keystroke.
// If showButton is true, the event is sent when the user click the OK button
'data' '38.1'  // you must define  'temperature' '42'  into dashboard 'vars' too.
// the hidden tile will listen to the inputs (the temperature upper), and send xpath event.
'value' { // in the same event, we will change two properties of the #temperature1 text
'innerHTML' \$temperature // innerHTML is a specific attribute that target the text inside the span
'fill' \$fillColor  // fill is an attribute. You can look at the DOM change with the developper tool console.
// (endpoint of your Warp 10 exec endpoint is mandatory if you also use Discovery Explorer)
// (can be light / dark / green / fresh / dark-blue / vintage)
'type' 'flex' // flex : no need to specify each tile x y position
'vars' { // list of dashboard variables (can be set via dashboard url too)
// list of tiles (type discovery-tiles to get some snippets)
'type' 'line'  'w' 4 'h' 4 // type can also be area, spline-area, step-area, spline, step, step-after, step-before
${1:[ NEWGTS 0 10 <% m NaN NaN NaN RAND ADDVALUE %> FOR ]}
//   'thresholds' [ // can also define markers, see doc.
//   { 'key' 'My sensor' 'datasetColor' '#8A2BE2' 'type' 'spline-area' { 'yAxis' 0 } }  // one configuration per output gts

'data' ${1:42.0} // any number or string, or html string. To display multiline, you can use '%0A' '
' REPLACEALL
//   'fadeOutAfter' 2 // the tile content fade out 2 seconds after the event
// 'localvars' {} // save a local variable for the next execution
'data' ${1:defaultValue}  // you must define  'startDate' ${1:defaultValue}  into dashboard 'vars' too.
// you must define  'startEndDates' [ ${1:defaultStartValue} ${2:defaultEndValue} ]  into dashboard 'vars' too.
// 'windowed' 10   // number of pages displayed in the page sector
{ 'data' \$values } // data can also be a gts or a list thereof
'data' \$values // data can also be a gts or a list thereof
// data can be a number, or a list of number for several gauge in the same tile
// for this type of gauge, minimum value is 0 and value cannot be negative
// data can be a number, or a list of number for several gauge in the same tile
// values is a list of [ X Y ] coordinates (try ZIP function !)
'data' \$value // it can also be a gts or list of gts
// => note marker can also be an SVG (<svg  ...> </svg>) (use multi line string to escape the percent and quotes easily)
// => you can generate icons from code too, thanks to PGraphics:
//'render' 'path' 'marker'  32 32 '2D2' PGraphics 4 PstrokeWeight 16 16 Ptranslate 0 3 <% DROP 6 RAND * Protate 0 0 10 10 Pline %> FOR Pencode
//'line' false // remove line that connect the dots
'mapType' 'SATELLITE' // map style NONE, DEFAULT, HOT, TOPO, TOPO2, STADIA, STADIA_DARK, TONER, TONER_LITE, TERRAIN, ESRI, SATELLITE, OCEANS, GRAY, GRAYSCALE, WATERCOLOR, CARTODB, CARTODB_DARK
'tiles' [ // extra tile servers to overlay on the map
'options' { 'eventHandler' 'tag=input,type=variable'  } // if you want your button to propagate variables to a popup, for example
// when loaded, a button returns a macro to execute on each click
// In this example, the button just send an event with an empty list of variable
// tiles listening it to will refresh ( 'eventHandler' 'type=variable,tag=(input|${1:applybutton})' in the tile options)
// try to insert  `discovery-event 01 popup` snippet here...
// If showButton is false, then the event is sent at each letter you type in the input field
//  This can lead to lots of events per second. To throttle this, you can use { 'showButton' false 'delayRequest' 1000 }:
//  It will delay the event to delayRequest milliseconds after last keystroke.
// If showButton is true, then the event is sent when the user click the OK button
'data' '${1:Default Value}'  // you must define  'inputText01' '${1:Default Value}'  into dashboard 'vars' too.
'type' 'input:list' 'w' 1 'h' 1   // try input:autocomplete if the choice list is too big
'globalParams' { 'input' { 'value' '${2:pressure}' } } // you must define  '${1:channelName}' '${2:pressure}'  into dashboard 'vars' too.
// when refering to a variable defined outside the tile macro and not in dashboard vars,
// use early binding:  !\$xxx  will replace the variable by its content during the first execution.
'type' 'input:multi-cb' 'w' 2 'h' 2   // try input:autocomplete if the choice list is too big
//  Without showButton, an event is sent on every click on a checkbox. To throttle this, you can use { 'showButton' false 'delayRequest' 2000 }:
//  It will delay the event to delayRequest milliseconds after last keystroke/click
'globalParams' { 'input' { 'value' ${2:[ 'sensor 1' 'sensor 3' ]} } } // you must define  '${1:checkBoxList}' ${2:[ 'sensor 1' 'sensor 3' ]} into dashboard 'vars' too.
// when refering to a variable defined outside the tile macro and not in dashboard vars,
// use early binding:  !\$xxx  will replace the variable by its content during the first execution.
'type' 'input:slider' 'w' 2 'h' 1   // try input:autocomplete if the choice list is too big
'options' { 'input' { 'showButton' true } 'button' { 'label' 'Go' } } // when false, event is sent when click is released
// you must define  '${2:triggerValue}' ${1:42.5} into dashboard 'vars' too.
// you must define  '${1:period}' '1 w' // default = week
// In this example, as the value is valid WarpScript, you can evaluate directly the result with \$period EVAL in the tiles listening to this event.
'type' 'dashboard' 'w' 4 'h' 4 // type can be dashboard:flex, or dashboard:scada, see documentation
'cols' 12 // the dashboard in the dashboard can have different properties
'options' { 'eventHandler' 'type=variable,tag=input' } // child dashboards listen to parent events.
'events' [ { 'tags' 'input' 'type' 'variable' 'selector' '${1:refName}' } ] // you must define  '${1:refName}' [ '${2:none}' ]  into dashboard 'vars' too.
'options' { 'input' { 'showButton' false  'accept' '.txt,.jpg,.png' } } // the accept filter can also be a mix of extensions and mime types: '.doc,.docx,.xml,application/msword'
// starting with the Mime type followed by the file content in base64, ie data:text/csv;base64,c2VyaWFsO2NsaWV(...)
'type' 'hidden' // hidden tiles are used to process events and fire new events (popup, xpath, style, variable, audio, zoom, focus, margin, bounds, selected, link, poi...)
SYMBOLS 'firstRun' CONTAINS <% // you may not want to send event at dashboard load. Using a tile local variable, you can discard the first execution.
${1:// insert events to send to other tiles here (try discovery event snippets)}
'data' '' // still needed for a hidden tile
'type' 'form' 'w' 4 'h' 5   // the form plugin documentation is available here https://www.npmjs.com/package/@senx/discovery-plugin-form
// 'eventHandler' 'type=variable,tag=input' // you can refresh the form up to an event
'input' { 'validation' true } // force validation of mandatory inputs
'events' [ { 'tags' [ 'input' ] 'type' 'variable' 'selector' '${1:formContent}' } ] // you must define  '${1:formContent}' {}  into dashboard 'vars' too.
'default' NOW  // if your platform unit is not s, don't forget to specify it in discovery options
'data'    [ 'the breakfast' 'the bathroom' 'the bed quality' 'the room service' { 'name' 'opt4' 'label' 'the sound insulation' } ]
[ NOW  1 h -  10 m ] ADDVALUE // system was on 10 minutes one hour ago
[ NOW  15 m -  5 m ] ADDVALUE // system was on 5 minutes 15 minutes ago
[ NOW  30 m -  15 m ] ADDVALUE // system was on 5 minutes 15 minutes ago
{ 'key' 'On Time'      'datasetColor' 'green' }  // one configuration per output gts
{ 'key' 'Failure Time' 'datasetColor' 'red' }  // one configuration per output gts
// This event will send an event to the dashbard itself. At the dashboard level, you must subscribe the event by adding:
'value' ${1:insert a discovery tile here, or a full dashboard structure with several tiles}
// this event will force some variables to be updated in all the tiles that subscribe to it
{ 'tags' [ 'input' ] 'type' 'variable' 'value' { '${1:myvar}' ${2:value} } } // make sure '${1:myvar}' is declared in the 'vars' of your dashboard
{ 'tags' [ 'chartzoom' ] 'type' 'zoom' } // tiles with 'options' { 'eventHandler' 'type=zoom,tag=chartzoom' } will listen to this event
// tabular tile and some graphics tiles can emit an event when selecting a line or a gts click:
{ 'tags' [ 'tableClick' ] 'type' 'selected' 'selector' 'lineSelected'  } // tiles with 'options' { 'eventHandler' 'type=selected,tag=tableClick' } will listen to it.
